definitions.definition: Someone who or something that trails ( follows behind); something that is trailing .
Part of an object which extends some distance beyond the main body of the object.
An unpowered wheeled vehicle (not a caravan or camper ) that is towed behind another, and used to carry equipment, etc., that cannot be carried in the leading vehicle.
examples: At the end of the day, we put the snowmobiles back on the trailer .

definitions.definition: A furnished vehicle towed behind another, and used as a dwelling when stationary.
examples: We drove our trailer to Yellowstone Park.

definitions.definition: A prefabricated home that could be towed to a new destination but is typically permanently left in an area designated for such homes.
examples: The young couple′s first home was in a trailer .

definitions.definition: A preview of a film, video game or TV show.
examples: The trailer for that movie makes it seem like it would be fun.

definitions.definition: A short blank segment of film at the end of a reel , for convenient insertion of the film in a projector .

The final record of a list of data items, often identified by a key field with an otherwise invalid value that sorts last alphabetically (e.g., “ZZZZZ”) or numerically (“99999”); especially common in the context of punched cards , where the final card is called a trailer card .
examples: The linked list terminates with a trailer record.

definitions.definition: The last part of a packet , often containing a check sequence.
examples: The encapsulation layer adds an eight-byte header and a two-byte trailer to each packet.

main_definition: Someone who or something that trails ( follows behind); something that is trailing .
secondary_definitions: Part of an object which extends some distance beyond the main body of the object.
An unpowered wheeled vehicle (not a caravan or camper ) that is towed behind another, and used to carry equipment, etc., that cannot be carried in the leading vehicle.
( US ) A furnished vehicle towed behind another, and used as a dwelling when stationary.
( US ) A prefabricated home that could be towed to a new destination but is typically permanently left in an area designated for such homes.
( chiefly US , media ) A preview of a film, video game or TV show.
A short blank segment of film at the end of a reel , for convenient insertion of the film in a projector .

( computing ) The final record of a list of data items, often identified by a key field with an otherwise invalid value that sorts last alphabetically (e.g., “ZZZZZ”) or numerically (“99999”); especially common in the context of punched cards , where the final card is called a trailer card .
( networking ) The last part of a packet , often containing a check sequence.
